metadata.title: CVE-2024-20968 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Options). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.34 and priorand 8.1.0. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows high privilegedattacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQLServer. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorizedability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) ofMySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.4 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mariadb-10.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
